intro: Fleischmannia profusa, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink to reddish in color, attracting various pollinators. Fleischmannia profusa is adapted to hot, dry environments and plays a role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and small mammals.
